Description: Jacob's jouney into Egypt; to right, Jacob seated on a horse leading a procession of animals including donkeys, sheep, camels, cows and dogs, accompanied by several walking figures, a woman and baby riding on a horse, and a further procession of people and animals descending a hill to left behind. c.1647 Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Stefano della Bella
Curator's comments: For the mounted impression of this print, see X,5.1
Acquisition notes: According to an annotation in the bill book, the prints purchased from William Radeke in 1871 came from the collection of W I Hooft. The annotation is ambiguous (it could be taken to refer only to the unique van Ostade) but it is supported by the fact that the collector's mark of Hooft is found on several of the etchings.
